meanings.definition: A solid exterior angle of a wall or building.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had sturdy quoins at its corners.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the quoins to strengthen the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the quoins but quickly gave up.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unyielding as the quoins holding up the tower.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast a shadow on the quoins, highlighting their strength.

meanings.definition: Wedge-shaped stones used to reinforce a corner in a wall.
meanings.sent1: The builder carefully selected the perfect quoins for the wall.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins still had intact quoins supporting the structure.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the quoins were magical stones from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The old wall stood tall, supported by the reliable quoins.
meanings.sent5: The artist sketched the intricate details of the ancient quoins in the corner.

meanings.definition: A metal or wooden wedge used to secure type in a chase.
meanings.sent1: The printer inserted the quoins to lock the type in place.
meanings.sent2: The apprentice learned how to adjust the quoins for different fonts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the tray of quoins, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like quoins, firmly setting the tone of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The old printing press still used traditional quoins to hold the type.
